channel.title: Java to class help[URGENT]
channel.description: Okay i really need help, i unpacked a file from .CLASS to .java and i need to change it back but i dont know how. Can someone please help i would really appreciate it :( :(

item.title: Java to class help[URGENT]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

How to compile using a .bat:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:542930”]Well no, because it’s different for each project you need to compile.

@echo off
TITLE Compiling
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_45\javac.exe" *.java
TITLE Finished
pause

That’s a skeleton for a compiler. Assuming you have JDK 7 update 45 installed into C:\Program Files.
If it’s not in there, check Program Files(x86).
If neither have JDK 7 (I’d say at least update 45) then you want to download a new one from their website and remove your old versions.
That batch code would compile any java file that’s in the same directory as the batch file.
If you want to add more directories or etc to it, you want to put a space after the *.java and the put the path\to\the\other\java\files\then*.java but make sure the path is relative to where the .bat file is.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @99ht 99ht
item.description:
@99ht wrote:

I’m trying to edit someone else’s client, but its a .class and to edit it i needed to change it to .java. however once i edited it i cant change it back to .class again. I’m needing to change it back to .class to go back on the server

Read full topic

item.title: Java to class help[URGENT]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well no, because it’s different for each project you need to compile.

@echo off
TITLE Compiling
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_45\javac.exe" *.java
TITLE Finished
pause

That’s a skeleton for a compiler. Assuming you have JDK 7 update 45 installed into C:\Program Files.
If it’s not in there, check Program Files(x86).
If neither have JDK 7 (I’d say at least update 45) then you want to download a new one from their website and remove your old versions.
That batch code would compile any java file that’s in the same directory as the batch file.
If you want to add more directories or etc to it, you want to put a space after the *.java and the put the path\to\the\other\java\files\then*.java but make sure the path is relative to where the .bat file is.

Read full topic

item.title: Java to class help[URGENT]
item.dc:creator: @99ht 99ht
item.description:
@99ht wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:542930”][quote author=99ht link=topic=661807.msg4423576#msg4423576 date=1399592981]

Wut?
The only way to convert a .class to .java is with a decompiler, otherwise you’d get unreadable jargon.

I’ve already changed it from a .CLASS to a .java, im asking how to change it back to a .CLASS
[/quote]
Dude, that’s basic java skills.
Compile.
Use an IDE, or write a .batch (windows) or whatever *nix uses.[/quote]
Going to sound really nooby here, but i have no idea how to do that. do you have a code for the .bat file?

Read full topic
